meanings.definition: Believing or teaching something that goes against accepted beliefs or doctrines.
meanings.sent1: The heretical idea shocked the community.
meanings.sent2: His heretical views on education were controversial.
meanings.sent3: The heretical notion of cats ruling the world amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her heretical fashion sense turned heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The heretical theory of gravity being upside down made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: Contrary to or differing from established beliefs or customs.
meanings.sent1: Their heretical behavior at the ceremony raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: The artist's heretical style challenged traditional norms.
meanings.sent3: The heretical decision to wear pajamas to work was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: His heretical approach to cooking involved using ice cream in every dish.
meanings.sent5: The heretical idea of painting the sky purple captivated the audience.
